ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Tells us what to do and what not to do.
I don't think I need to recommend this course to other students since this is a mandatory course.
Chem 590 is a matter of duty. Those who have to take it will, and those who don't won't.
Yes. Basic ethics for one conducting research.
Good to get general idea about ethics.
Interesting class. The topics covered are interesting, things you may not always know or even look into.
Its very very important to attend this class.

I would recommend this course to other students, even if it is not required for study, as it helped me to learn about possible downfalls and preventative measures that can be taken to insure adequate and ethical research throughout my chemical career.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It's very necessary and helpful teaching on ethics and academic integrity in my future research and career.
Made more aware of the ethical issues involved in research.

It fightened me a little, as it should, to see how the scientific world that I want to enter monitters itself. I can only hope never to be in a situation where my ethics are questions, or where I must question those of others.
This class was a good discussion about current ethical breaches in the field.
Yes. Basic ethics for one conducting research.
Course does what it's supposed to do. Instructor is funny and engaging.
I got the idea that how important it is to be honest.
Applicable in terms of what not to do and raised awareness about things that can be happening around you.

This course opened me to a part of the chemical field that I was previously unaware of. I now know how to prevent misinterpretation of my own results, while keeping a watchful eye for results from others that may be incorrect, misinterpreted, or even fabricated. This course will be highly beneficial toward insuring that my future research remains accurate and ethical.
